intro: Couepia bracteosa var. minor, commonly known as the small-bracted couepia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant features opposite, simple leaves with a rough texture and small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological characteristics and ecological adaptations.
